item.title: This American R
item.description: library(tidyverse) ?theme_set tal <- read_csv("~/Documents/HKS/rtutorial/data/this_american_life/tal_complete.csv") tal1 <- tal %>% slice(1) tal1 %>% select(content) %>% mutate(content = str_replace_all(content, "\\n|\\\n", " ") %>% str_trim(.,"both")) ## # A tibble: 1 x 1 ## content ## <chr> ## 1 "1: New Beginnings Transcript Originally aired 11.17.1995 Note: This Americâ€¦ tal_tidy <- tal %>% slice(1:100) %>% tidytext::unnest_tokens("word", content) %>% mutate(title = str_replace_all(title, "\\\n", " ") %>% str_replace(., "Transcript.+Originally aired.+", "")) %>% anti_join(tidytext::stop_words) tal_tf_idf <- tal_tidy %>% select(title, word) %>% group_by(title) %>% count(word, sort = TRUE) %>% ungroup() %>% tidytext::bind_tf_idf(word, title, n) tal_tf_idf %>% group_by(title) %>% arrange(-tf_idf) %>% slice(1:10) %>% summarise(top_words = str_c(word, collapse = ", ")) %>% ungroup() %>% left_join(tal_tidy %>% distinct(title, air_date, show_number)) %>% arrange(air_date) %>% mutate(title_words = str_c(title, top_words, sep = ": ")) %>% ggplot() + geom_text(aes(-show_number, 0, label = title_words), size = 5) + # scale_x_date(date_labels = "%y-%m-%d") + theme(axis.
